Record.ClassificationPath: Findings_and_Disorders_Kind/Disease, Disorder or Finding/Disease or Disorder/Disorder by Site/Head and Neck Disorder/Oral Disorder/Oral Cavity Disorder/Non-Neoplastic Oral Cavity Disorder/Hairy Tongue
Record.Description: A benign condition of the tongue characterized by hypertrophy of the filiform papillae that give the dorsum of the tongue a furry appearance. The color of the elongated papillae varies from yellowish white to brown or black, depending upon staining by substances such as tobacco, food, or drugs. (Dorland, 27th ed)
